name: Four Points by Sheraton Houston West

reviews.text: -Good location... many restaurants and shopping aroun
reviews.title: Typical Four Points Sheraton in a good central location

reviews.text: -Clean and well run
reviews.title: Nice break

reviews.text: -Can be noisy but ask for a room that faces the pool
reviews.title: Noisy location

reviews.text: -Would stay again if I am in the area as I am a Starwood Platinum Member
reviews.title: Spacious suites

reviews.text: -Plenty of free parking and there was a security guard roaming the parking lot... which is a good thing
reviews.title: The Haunted hotel....ewwww scary

reviews.text: We were at this hotel late August on a family trip. Had a room on the second floor.Staff was friendly and very helpful, especially because were there with little children.
reviews.title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE

reviews.text: Didn't eat the hotel though. .
reviews.title: Stay was as expected

reviews.text: The inside of the hotel was pretty nice. We were placed in a room that was on the ground floor facing the parking lot which felt a bit like a cheaper motel, but the room was nice. The shower head flow was very light. I felt like I needed to run around in the shower to get wet. They had free coffee available every morning in the lobby, and I really appreciated that. There was a very strong presence of security in the parking areas which made me wonder if the area was dangerous, but I appreciated their presence. Overall, it was a good experience. Got a really great rate through Priceline.
reviews.title: Exceptional service with a nod to a Zen-like atmoshpere

reviews.text: I lived 24/7 at this hotel....with business meetings for five full days and the staff never disappointed. From the front desk, who secured taxis to the manager of the restaurant--people were genuine and helpful.They could not do enough to ensure that the time spent at their site was pleasant and productive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Food was fabulous and fresh. The Grill (restaurant on site) offers a contemporary menu (ahi tuna with wasabi was a standout) filled with foods that succeed because of their local ingredients and not heavy sauces. Meeting snacks and lunches offered a varienty each day, and always had fresh fruit, interesting yogurt shots or granola bars along with the traditional cake or cookies.
reviews.title: Good stay and great offer to support green champaign

reviews.text: Bottom line---lovely food, comfortable rooms, relaxing decor and a stupendous staff.
reviews.title: Great hotel and service perfect for my business needs!

reviews.text: Stayed here 11/13 - 11/16 in a suite. Nice, seperate living room with a nice desk to get work done (traveled on business). Bedroom was clean and quiet. I got a good nights sleep every night. The location to resturants is also good - plenty of options.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Only two "nits" I had was 1) the breakfast buffet is pretty poor, especailly for the price and 2) no dresser in the room. They have these silly boxes under shelves...a little wierd.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else

reviews.text: I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Business Hotel

reviews.text: You're right by the highway so it's loud all night. I was "upgraded" to a room right by the elevator, which is also dinging constantly all night. The breakfast is marginal at best--coffee was awful and toast was bland. My TV didn't work and the tub didn't drain during my shower. The only thing that seemed to work was the complimentary shuttle to nearby locations. Prompt and courteous driver. But that's not worth booking a room here. If you're gonna spend the money there are plenty of nearby hotels that are cleaner and nicer. I was here on business and my colleagues were at two other hotels in the vicinity and they had much more pleasant stays.
reviews.title: Not bad but not great just average

reviews.text: I visited for 6 nights in Feb 2013. It's very much a business hotel with limited amenities at weekends. It only has one open-plan bar/restaurant area which to be fair was clean and service wasn't too bad although at times bar staff were called on to do other duties and with only one person on the bar it means no service at times!
reviews.title: It is what it is - 3-star by the freeway...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room on 7th floor was a 'suite' - 2 rooms knocked into 1 - and overall was fine, not luxurious but spacious and typical Sheraton comfortable bed. Bathroom was tiny but clean enough. Traffic noise from VERY adjacent freeway is constant but not overwhelming so I did sleep.
reviews.title: Comfortable, but older building

reviews.text: Fitness room small but functional - I used it four times - and pool didn't attract me enough to try as it's outdoors and it was a little cool...
reviews.title: Not My Kind of Hotel

reviews.text: Best thing for a business traveller is access to freeway, and other plus is it's location next to 'CityCentre' and 'Town and Country' shopping areas - less than 5 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service- SPG Finnest

reviews.text: Overall, I'd probably give it a 7 out of 10 which equates to 3 out of 5 on TA - can't give it 4 out of 5!
reviews.title: Nice Location
Meets my requirements every time
reviews.text: Stayed here many times. Location,rooms,amenities suit my needs when visiting Houston. The front desk provide good service. Limited restaurant service during the holiday was inconvenient but that is ok. Good modern decor without too many frills. Free wifi. Free water in rooms. I always seem to have a problem with hot water in the shower but think I have cracked the code following this trip. I am sure to use this hotel again. It was also good to see security in the car park and around the building for more comfort.

What a pleasant surprise this hotel turned out to be. I got an upgrade for $155 a night to their King Executive Suite - two large separate rooms with a wet bar, mini fridge, two flat screen TV's, two closets. I needed a large room for an in-room meeting this trip and this was perfect with comfortable seating. The location is at the intersection of I-10 and Sam Houston Expressway and the room was very quiet. The PTEC air conditioners were incredibly quiet. The bathroom was small, but functional. The location is adjacent to a brand new shopping complex with several restaurants. The lobby and bar were very nice and comfortable and open. The breakfast buffet (very tasty eggs, bacon, potatoes) was included. There was a comfortable full bar as well. On the service side, I asked for a late checkout and they gave me until 4 p.m.! No charge.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise in fresh remodel

reviews.text: The worst Internet speeds I have seen anywhere, faster in Zimbabwe honestly. Sure, everyone is on n the evening, but that's o surprise, happens every evening. Get more bandwidth then!
reviews.title: SLOW Internet, bad for business, good otherwise

reviews.text: Rooms are nice, great renovation, last time I stayed here was in 1989 when still an ITT Sheraton, h own things have changed!
reviews.title: Very humid rooms

reviews.text: Great staff, clean rooms but very humid, more so than outside. Now I know ouston is a humid climate but it was actually nice there for a change. I thought the AC would help, and it did some, but still things where humid in the room. Very small and cramped bathroom for 3 people sharing a room. Not great for the price.
reviews.title: Bland rooms, very close to the freeway, but nice staff!

reviews.text: I had a 2 room suite - a room with a sofa, chair, table and TV plus another room with a bedroom also with TV . The furnishings were very functional and basic. Apart from this, it's a bit close to the freeway and if you're on the end next to the road, you hear the traffic all night. That said the free breakfast was excellent; the staff were great; and there's a free shuttle to the Memorial Mall. So, in a nutshell, it's perfectly adequate as long as you don't spend too much to stay there.
reviews.title: Very Good for Business Meetings

aka: 4 Points By Sheraton Houston, Memorial City
description: Four Points by Sheraton Houston West offers a great location on the corner of Katy Freeway and Beltway 8 (Sam Houston Tollroad) nearby the Memorial City Mall and Memorial Hermann Hospital.
